comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

issue.title: utm_content parameter is not removed from deezer
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.deezer.com/en/track/143032368??utm_content=track-143032368&deferredFl=1

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

utm_content parameter is in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TrackParamFilter/sections/general_url.txt but it's not being removed from deezer URLs: https://www.deezer.com/en/track/143032368??utm_content=track-143032368&deferredFl=1

it's not on allowlist so I don't understand why it's not being removed.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: What appears the situation, is that Deezer has somehow managed to use *2* question marks before the `utm` part. I can try to fix the part in *Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List*, hopefully.

issue.title: aniwave.to
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://aniwave.to](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Faniwave.to) ### Comment > This happens when upon entering the site and tapping the ‘Go to Homepage’ button, it will open another site that is similar to the site itself. Though this happens at least once when you are not using the your device for hours and the issue will not reappear until tomorrow, but the fact that upon tapping the in-site button will open and send you to another site is very annoying. > > Is there any AdGuard filter that I should have enabled or is this a AdGuard filter that needs updating? > > Let me know when there is an update. Username: `@Ian Chen` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
Screenshot 1 [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/r1mqmi5j73ko8gw4gscsgosw08sow88eghmpfyzzbs.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.1 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `System`, `Default`, `(Regular)`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/dns/filter_1_ios.txt` Filters: | Ad Blocking:
